manifest.description:
This file contains a list detailing other Fanoos related work. We do not promise that this list is comprehensive. For instance, at a minimum, it does not have the ArXiv write-up of Fanoos listed comprehensively. Our intent in this repo is to list and provide as much content relating to Fanoos as possible that (1) has been publicly communicated (2) is not yet archived elsewhere; as we detail in the next paragraph, an aim of this manifest is to provide a guarantee that content has not changed beyond the date of being posted here / listed in previous git commits in this repo. In other words, the aim is to create an accurate and accountable record of otherwise unarchived mass communications regarding Fanoos and related work.
TO CONFIRM THE SHA512 HASH AND FILE SIZE OF THIS MANIFEST, BOTH IN PRESENT AND PREVIOUS VERSIONS, SEE THE APPENDIX OF THE WRITE-UP AT: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2006.12453.pdf Since ArXiv does not allow removal, overwriting, or modifications or submitted write-ups, the hash and files size reported allows one to check whether we have modified this manifest since the time of the ArXiv upload. As a result, this also allows one to check that none of the files listed have been modified. If the file was modified, then its hash and/or file size would (almost certainly) change, which would not match this manifest - unless we modified the manifest, but then the hash and/or size of this manifest would (almost certainly) change, which would then fail to match ArXiv - and we do not have the ability to modify ArXiv. This creates a chain of trust, where one can trust that we did not modify content. While theoretically meaningful modifications are possible without changing the hash and file size, making such changes is largely infeasible since (1) reversing sha512 hashes is hard (at least for us, the authors), usually requiring non-trivial resources (time/computer power) to find an effective attack, (2) even if we succeed in finding a file with the same hash and size, the new file would not necessarily contain changes that are meaningful or desirable.

i.venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence 2020 Workshop on Explainable Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI-XAI 2020)
i.title: Fanoos: Multi-Resolution, Multi-Strength, Interactive Explanations for Learned Systems

i.venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence 2020 Workshop on Explainable Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI-XAI 2020)
i.title: Supplemental Material Zip File

i.venue: International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence 2020 Workshop on Explainable Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI-XAI 2020)
i.title: Fanoos: Multi-Resolution, Multi-Strength, Interactive Explanations for Learned Systems
i.fileDescription:
This file contains a PDF version of slides shown for the presentation of Fanoos at IJCAI-XAI 2020; the presentation started in the latter part of hour3 day8 month1 year2021 (UTC) and ended no later than the first few minutes of hour4 day8 month1 year2021 (UTC). The presentation was a slide-deck; it has been exported to a PDF here for easier inclusion in this repo. Prior to exporting the PDF, some minor adjustments were done to ensure all intended content was viewable. For example, animations in the original presentation often occluded content; effected slides have been split into multiple parts in this PDF, showing the appearance before and after the animation. The pdf was generated on minute43 hour6 day11 month4 year2021 (UTC)
While many talks during the workshop were recorded, the presentation for Fanoos was not since consent was not provided by the speaker for a recording to be made and/or shared.

i.venue: The 2020 CMU Symposium on Artificial Intelligence and Social Good
i.fileDescription: Picture of the AI and Social Good Website and our reserved presentation slot.

i.venue: The 2020 CMU Symposium on Artificial Intelligence and Social Good
i.title: Policy and ML-Assisted Decision Making: The Need for Multi-Resolution, Multi-Strength, Interactive Explanations of Learned Systems
i.fileDescription: The slides sent to the symposium organizers for a backup presentation in case video presentations had technical difficulties. We were informed that the slides would be posted online by the organizers after the event. To the best of our knowledge, at the time of writing this note ( 02:53:37 UTC 22 Sep 2020 ), these slides are not yet available through the symposium.

i.venue: International Conference on Automated Planning and Scheduling 2020 International Workshop of Explainable AI Planning (ICAPS-XAIP 2020)
i.fileDescription: Picture of the ICAPS-XAIP 2020 website page that lists the materials for Fanoos. Screenshot taken on day24 month10 year2020.

i.venue: International Conference on Automated Planning and Scheduling 2020 International Workshop of Explainable AI Planning (ICAPS-XAIP 2020)
i.title: (Poster) Fanoos: Multi-Resolution, Multi-Strength, Interactive Explanations for Learned Systems
i.fileDescription:
Poster submitted to the ICAPS-XAIP 2020 workshop. After checking, both the poster submitted and the png provided online by the workshop are the same (so there was no additional compression or meta-data added, etc.). A pdf file of the poster was also submitted to the workshop organizers, but they preferred the png; while later the decision may be reversed, at the time being I see little utility in providing the pdf here as well. In case it proves useful for the record, the sh512sum of the pdf file was a447c4456e5eb7090274946d5c1557b93393cee1f3c6f1f53a3ea8df2a1333635cb2c40a69c4e77950cc717a2c7c27fdcd3fb6cf786eac945bd885bf3cafc636 and the file size was 716934 bytes.
This poster was displayed and discussed during the second poster session of the workshop.

i.venue: International Conference on Automated Planning and Scheduling 2020 International Workshop of Explainable AI Planning (ICAPS-XAIP 2020)
i.title: Fanoos: Multi-Resolution, Multi-Strength, Interactive Explanations for Learned Systems
i.fileDescription:
Paper listed online for ICAPS-XAIP 2020 workshop. After checking, it is identical to the one provide for IJCAI-XAI 2020, which is to be expected since the ICAPS-XAIP presentation was arranged in collaboration with the sibling workshop, IJCAI-XAI. I list the pdf here for the record's sake, despite the duplication, though I might reverse this decision later.
Fanoos was shown as a poster presentation at ICAPS-XAIP; the paper is provided online by ICAPS-XAIP to facilitate reference by workshop attendees, etc. In contrast, at IJCAI-XAI, a paper talk regarding Fanoos will be given. This is to say that the involvement and delivery at the two venues is not repetitive.

i.title: Description of Analysis of Learned Controllers (Neural Nets) Currently Used in Group as of Day7 Month6 Year2019: The Possibilities for Abstractions, Descriptions and Possible Proofs of Behavior Document UUID: bcfe849d-4394-435d-8cb9-423cf0c1e497
i.fileDescription:
Essentially an improved and far extended version of the write-up pointed to in this manifest under the item with UUID dff902a3-19f4-4fa3-87dc-77be952cb51f.
Note that the name of the document - which makes reference to day7 month6 year2019 - refers to which day the document (as separate from the earlier writings ) was created and began being written. The document was write by D Bayani, who later emailed it to the people listed in the document on minute50 hour23 day12 month6 year2019 (UTC). This document is not provided in this repository; see the item in this manifest with UUID 3d4f8f56-b134-424b-8e05-d8fc7ed019fa for a redacted version of this write-up. Note that this document contains result-types that were not adopted in Fanoos (such as visual plots and "task agnostic" exploration of spaces), in addition to efforts that did feed into the core of Fanoos.

i.title: Description of Analysis of Learned Controllers (Neural Nets) Currently Used in Group as of Day7 Month6 Year2019: The Possibilities for Abstractions, Descriptions and Possible Proofs of Behavior Document UUID: bcfe849d-4394-435d-8cb9-423cf0c1e497
i.fileDescription: Redacted version of the document which is listed in this manifest under the item with uuid 30b98938-7b14-4681-8279-3e539528aba6 . Note that the name of the file - which makes reference to day7 month6 year2019 - is based on the original file name, which expressed which day the document (as separate from the earlier, shorter writings described in the item of this manifest with UUID dff902a3-19f4-4fa3-87dc-77be952cb51f ) was created and began being written.

i.title: Description of Stability Analysis Process and Results Document UUID: d0b509df-70a7-4356-8b68-7b083d8b5208
i.fileDescription:
This write-up describes some thoughts, implementations, and conducted experiments leading up to the approach solidified in Fanoos; the "official start" of D Bayani's work relating to Fanoos was certainly no later than this (see the notes in the document listed under the manifest item with UUID 30b98938-7b14-4681-8279-3e539528aba6 for discussion of some relevant materials that preceded this). Note that this document contains result-types that were not adopted in Fanoos (such as visual plots and "task agnostic" exploration of spaces), in addition to efforts that did feed into the core of Fanoos.
The document was write by D Bayani, who later emailed it to the people listed in the write-up on minute23 hour10 day31 month5 year2019 (UTC). This document is not provided in this repository; see the item in this manifest with UUID dff902a3-19f4-4fa3-87dc-77be952cb51f for a redacted version of this material.

i.title: Description of Stability Analysis Process and Results Document UUID: d0b509df-70a7-4356-8b68-7b083d8b5208
i.fileDescription: Redacted version of the document which is listed in this manifest under the item with uuid 069a4e76-558a-4e97-847a-90984adb3cb5 . Note that the name of the file - which makes reference to day29 month5 year2019 - is based on the original file name, which expressed which day writing began.

i.title: Description of Idea for Operator Selection, Mixing Both Expert Knowledge and Learning Document UUID: 3eb28d00-0d06-4b26-828e-126026308900
i.fileDescription: Write-up describing ideas on theories, implementations, and agendas for extensions of Fanoos, particularly relating to a learning-based approach for automatically selecting operators. The content and writing was by D Bayani, who sent it to S Mitsch via email on minute43 hour0 day17 month1 year2020 (UTC). Brief comments relating to some thoughts expounded in this document can be found in the appendix of the IJCAI-XAI write-up (pointed to in this manifest's item with UUID 86b2f6f7-3b3b-45af-b76c-9f36de49f842 ).
Tarred and compressed code for Fanoos cloned from GitHub as of hour22 day11 month4 year2021 (UTC). Includes the master and development branches.
Tarred and compressed code for Fanoos cloned from GitHub as of hour7 day27 month4 year2021 (UTC). Includes the master, development, and experimental branches.
